data.title: Pujol Surname Origin, Meaning & Last Name History
data.meta_description: Learn the fascinating origin of the Pujol surname; its meaning & distribution. Unlock your family history in the largest database of last names.
data.text:
Where Does The Last Name Pujol Come From? nationality or country of origin

Pujol (Marathi: पुजोल) occurs most in Spain. It can appear as a variant:. Click here to see other possible spellings of this surname.

How Common Is The Last Name Pujol? popularity and diffusion

This surname is the 13,632nd most commonly used last name worldwide It is held by approximately 1 in 177,945 people. This surname is predominantly found in Europe, where 71 percent of Pujol reside; 37 percent reside in Southwestern Europe and 37 percent reside in Iberian Europe. Pujol is also the 2,187,323rd most widespread first name internationally, borne by 24 people.

Pujol is most widely held in Spain, where it is carried by 14,640 people, or 1 in 3,193. In Spain it is most frequent in: Catalonia, where 82 percent are found, Balearic Islands, where 9 percent are found and Valencian Community, where 2 percent are found. Barring Spain this surname is found in 77 countries. It is also common in France, where 35 percent are found and Argentina, where 9 percent are found.

Pujol Family Population Trend historical fluctuation

The incidence of Pujol has changed through the years. In The United States the number of people who held the Pujol surname rose 3,640 percent between 1880 and 2014 and in England it rose 7,800 percent between 1881 and 2014.

Pujol Last Name Statistics demography

In The United States Pujol are 42.54% more likely to be registered with the Democratic Party than The US average, with 95.77% being registered with the political party.

The amount Pujol earn in different countries varies greatly. In Norway they earn 48.68% less than the national average, earning 177,613 kr per year; in Colombia they earn 7.17% more than the national average, earning $24,329,500 COP per year; in United States they earn 6.97% more than the national average, earning $46,157 USD per year and in Canada they earn 6.6% less than the national average, earning $46,406 CAD per year.
